page.title: 05FARM & ELVASTON PARK Ref P.6
page.content: {Home Farm,}in addition to providing rough grazing for cattle,grows a mixture of crops. The area of {Elvaston Castle Country {Park}represented within this grid square shows a balanced ecological system.The landscaped pool provides a source of food and shelter for a range of migrating and resident water birds. The woodland,although predominantly deciduous,contains a wide variety of species of coniferous trees. Rangers from the{Study Centre}lead field visits by groups from schools.In June 1985 one such visit by {Asterdale {School}8/9 year old pupils took place. Half the cost of transport was paid by the Study Centre.Follow-up work was completed at school,mounted and sent to the Centre for display.Over fifty different insects and other creatures were collected in a 30minute period.
